sect1.title: Histogram
sect1.para: The Histogram tool is designed to provide you with detailed information about the image value structure.

listitem.para: When you click on the image with the Histogram tool, a dialog will be displayed showing detailed information about the way your image is structured by value.
The dropdown list will allow you to select the color channel or alpha channel that you wish to have the information displayed for.

Value is a composite channel containing the information for all channels. Red, Green, and Blue are channels that relate directly to the color component of the named color. Alpha shows the information regarding the alpha channel of the image. For further information on channels, see the glossary entry Channels. For further information regarding Alpha, see the glossary entry Alpha.
The two spinboxes allow manual control of the range currently under scrutiny. The left spinbox indicates the left or start value and the right spinbox indicates the right or end value.
You can select a range using the mouse by clicking and dragging within the visual histogram representation.
This number represents the mean value of the currently selected range of values.
This number represents the standard deviation of the currently selected range of values.
This number represents the median value of the currently selected range of values.
This number represents the total number of pixels in the image.
This number indicates the number of pixels in the current range.
This figure represents the percentage of the total number of pixels that are currently in range.
